Author: Captain_Jack#0015
Content: hope this doesn't put me on the plank...but here is my 2 cent - It will be unique features (proprietary/patented) alongside opensource code that competes for usability in the currency market....that usability is what will win....BTC as a crytpo reserve works well as it allows other currencies to peg to it for security and value (a la dPOW or a tether coin)...but I think the original BTC folks are a bit pissed that BTC is more and more relegated to a reserver currency while other pegged currencies get all the fame and action.  RV/CSW are in this boat...how to make BTC be the day to day currency...they neither one wanted the BCH fork but they were 'stabbed' in the back by Jihan/bitmain splitting BTC in the first place.  To sum this up:  1.  Jihan at Bitmain wants 1000's of alts so they can sell equipment....2.  RV wants development...3.  CSW wants the old BTC vision.    They all win with the centralization of money...as they all get richer.  I can see all perspectives...which is needed by humanity now?  I think #2 and #3 are still in the best interests of humanity...but Jihan is just another capitalist corporation imo.  With all of that said...where does that leave the alts?  In the long run they will compete with BCH(by whatever name) and evolve into the transactional  winner.  I personally think that will be KMD or ZEN (maybe ETH)...but they better get some patented stuff in the mix or the next 'new' open sourced solution di jour will vacuum up their ideas and win competitively...the ecosystem is the key differentiator.  So keep up the good work devs and let's change the world while the old folks keep debating who has the biggest peni$ while doing the scrooge mcduck swim in their piles of gold.

Author: PHBA2061#2530
Content:
*Coin Dance is now able to declare that both active chains will continue to be permanently split into the foreseeable future. The majority of businesses in the cryptocurrency ecosystem are now using Bitcoin Cash (BCH) to refer to the chain maintained by miners operating in consensus with the latest implementations from Bitcoin ABC, Bitcoin Unlimited, Bitprim, Bitcoin XT, bcash, and bchd. A number of exchanges have added support for the Bitcoin SV chain under the Bitcoin SV (BSV / BCHSV) name but general app support is currently very limited. Expect to see announcements made from each of the major companies in the Bitcoin Cash ecosystem that clarify which chain(s) they will support going forward.*
*The Bitcoin SV community believes that dedicated hash is the key mechanism used for building network consensus. The Bitcoin Cash community believes that that miners, developers, businesses, and individuals should all have a voice on future protocol changes. Over time, we will see which of these two viewpoints ends up getting us closer to that dream of building digital cash for the entire world.*
